_header: A little tale I will you tell
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 22.
_description: Strife in the house! a carol — fourteen quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘At þe townys end’ plus burden (cc): ‘Alas sayd þe gudman thi ys an hevy lyff / And all ys well þat endyth well said þe gud wyff’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
A lytyll tale I will you tellThe very trowth how it
                    befell…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Lest he be knokked a bowt þe pateThem to repent yt ys to
                    lateWhen on his cheke he ys chekmateAt þe townys
                    endExplicit
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
